description: I got used to myself, to my things, to my life, to being alone...
title: I got used to
content:
I got used to
occupying the entire bed when I sleep,
not cooking on Sundays,
and coming back whenever I want.

I got used to
not giving explanations,
doing what I like,
without anyone judging me.

I got used to
eating at midnight,
watching my favorite shows,
singing loudly,
and dancing throughout the house.

I got used to
getting calls constantly,
replying to messages very late,
going out with friends,
and traveling on some weekends.

I got used to
the smell of coffee in the mornings,
walking barefoot in the garden,
taking my time when getting ready,
and cancelling plans at the last minute
just because.

I got used to
me,
my things,
my life,
being alone...

author: Anonymous
description: There's nothing more beautiful than your face, nor anything sweeter than your smile...
title: The most beautiful
content:
There's nothing more beautiful than your face,
nor anything sweeter than your smile.
You are the light that illuminates my space,
and the dream that fills me with delight.

I wish I could be the air you breathe,
and the sun that warms you every day.
I wish I could be the moon that watches you,
and the verse that sings poetry to you.

But I know I can't be everything,
nor do I pretend to have you just for me.
I just want you to know how I feel.

That I love you with all my soul and life,
that you are my reason and meaning,
and without you, I'd have no joy.

author: Pablo Neruda
description: I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz...
title: Soneto XVII
content:
I don't love you as if you were a rose of salt, a topaz,
 or an arrow of carnations that spread fire:
 I love you like certain dark things are loved,
 secretly, between the shadow and the soul.

 I love you like the plant that It does not bloom and carries
within itself, hidden, the light of those flowers,
and thanks to your love it lives darkly in my body
the tight aroma that rose from the earth.

I love you without knowing how, or when, nor from where,
I love you directly without problems or pride:
this is how I love you because I don't know how to love any other way,

but this way in which I am not nor are you,
so close that your hand on my chest is mine,
so close that your eyes close with my dream.
